meanings.definition: The lowest deck in a ship, usually below the waterline.
meanings.sent1: The sailors stored supplies in the orlops of the ship.
meanings.sent2: The crew gathered on the orlops to discuss their next voyage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat got stuck in the orlops and needed rescuing.
meanings.sent4: The orlops of the ship were like a hidden world beneath the waves.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the orlops was both eerie and fascinating to the young sailor.

meanings.definition: A platform or deck built over the after part of the poop deck on a sailing ship.
meanings.sent1: The captain stood on the orlops, surveying the vast ocean ahead.
meanings.sent2: The crew members enjoyed the view from the orlops during calm seas.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls perched on the orlops, hoping for a snack from the sailors.
meanings.sent4: The orlops provided a strategic vantage point for spotting other ships.
meanings.sent5: The wooden planks of the orlops creaked softly under the sailors' feet.
